datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 25
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper may suggest 18th century.
Accompanying materials: Slip of laid paper (paginated p.9-10) and slip with notes (possibly of bookseller, paginated pp.13-14).
Former Shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 79. Al-Alfiyah fi 'l-hadith." ; "١٧٢" on tail of textblock.

Binding: Pasteboards covered in laid paper with spine and edges/turn-ins in brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap, though now lost) ; board linings in a yellow paper ; hinges in pink ; repairs in blue cloth ; sewn in blue thread, two stations ; endbands mostly gone ; in poor condition with much moisture damage, staining, abrasion, lifting and loss of leather (spine lining exposed), delaminating of boards, etc.
Support: European laid paper with 10 laid lines per cm. (vertical) and chain lines spaced 30 mm. apart (horizontal) ; watermarkof three crescents overlaid, each in a different orientation.
Decoration: Text rubricated with headings, etc. in red.

Script: Nastaʻlīq (talik) ; neat Turkish hand ; virtually serifless ; mainly closed counters ; slight effect of words descending to baseline as well as gentle slant to the right ; almost fully vocalized.
Layout: Written in 17 lines per page, divided to two columns ; frame-ruled.

Collation: 3 V (30), III+1 (37) ; chiefly quinions ; four leaves of final quire left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (skips two pages between p.53-54 and includes inserts).
Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads: "تمت بعون الله وبمنه وحسن توفيقه وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد واله وصحبه وسلم"
Explicit: "فربنا المحمود والمشكور اليه منا ترجع الامور وافضل الصلاة والسلام على النبي سيد الاناب"

Incipit: "يقول راجي ربه المقتدر عبد الرحيم بن الحسين الاثري من بعد حمد الله ذي الالاء على امتنان جل عن احصاء ثم صلاة وسلام دائم على نبي الخير ذي المرحم فهذه المقاصد المهمة توضح من علم الحديث رسمه نظمتها تبصرة للمبتدي تذكرة للمنتهي والمسند..."
Versification in alif of a collection of ḥadīth by Ibn al-Salāḥ al-Shahrazūrī (d. 643/1243).
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on inner front cover, "No. 79. Al-Alfiyah fi 'l-hadith." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "359" in Western numerals on fol.1a (p.1) ; circular waqf-seal impression in black ink appears on fol.1a (p.1) and several places throughout reads: "هذا وقف الراجي فيض الصمدي الشيخ احمد ضيا الدين ابن مصطفى الخالدي فمن بدله بعد ما سمعه فانما اثمه على الذين يبدلونه" in name of Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khālidī (i.e. Ahmed Ziyâüddîn Gümüşhanevî, d. 1893 or 4) ; occasionaly marginal corrections ; inscription on fol.1a (p.1) provides a listing of the various shurūḥ on this work and their authors.
Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ al-Shahrazūrī, ʻUthmān ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān,
